author: cbs8
title: CATCH A LOT Facilitates the "Jugging" Fishing Method - Designed by InventHelp Client (QCY-124)
text:
A leading invention firm, InventHelp is working to submit the CATCH A LOT to companies for their review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 24, 2015
The "jugging" fishing method is often regulated to limit the number of jugs that can be kept on a boat at one time. Also, jugging takes up a lot of space and can be difficult to do by one person. "In order to make such fishing easier and more effective, I designed an alternative," said an inventor from Statesville, N.C. He then created a prototype of his idea.
The CATCH A LOT facilitates the "jugging" method of fishing, which allows for more successful catches. It doesnâ€™t take up a lot of boat space, and it enables a user to perform the task without assistance. Compact and easy to use, it's safe for the environment and can be used in all kinds of waters.
The original design was submitted to the Fort Mill office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-QCY-124, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
